question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?
response_text: This class presented some very particular expectations and focused on skills I haven't had to think about before. The process of figuring out the incident lists for a given movie and determining character motivations really made me think.

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?

course: THEATRST-284S-01 : HOW TO WRITE A HORROR MOVIE.THEATRST-284S-01.CINE-281S-01.ENGLISH-223S-01.
question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?
response_text:
This is such a unique course, and was a wonderful experience! I think the horror genre is fascinating, though I hadn't had much contact with it previously, and it's great that we got to engage with it in an academic context. Professor Bell was great, and I had so much fun with this class. There's a lot of writing, but I think that's a good part of the class. Making myself dive into writing for a new medium (as I had no previous experience with screenwriting) is what really started to give me a sense for what goes into a script.
Stay on top of your long script at the end, though. Checkpoints are built into the class, so don't get behind on them, because that 80 page script is very manageable if broken up over multiple weeks, but very scary if you've let it pile up!

course: THEATRST-284S-01 : HOW TO WRITE A HORROR MOVIE.THEATRST-284S-01.CINE-281S-01.ENGLISH-223S-01.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: I learned how to properly screen write. I learned how to develop a story. I learned how to consider my audience when crafting a scene/ in general when writing a piece meant to be read by others.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: How to format a script. How to improve dialogue. How to write a beat sheet.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: I learned a lot of skills that I haven't had the opportunity to develop at Duke as a stem student. For example, I gained experience in creating an original plot and considering how to leverage individual scenes to create the best experience for the viewer; how to develop a plot alongside peers and work together to ensure that our plot is continuous and logical; and how to format a script.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.

-generation of ideas beyond what tv shows already exist

-the challenges of continuity when designing a season

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: I learned about how to create more natural dialogue, how to write more concisely, and how to work with others who might not have the same writing styles/ideas

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: In this class we were thinking about how to plot, format, and write television screenplays. Through this class I learned about screenplay formatting, the level of detail required to write a TV episode, and how to connect plot points in a sensical way.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: The class is formatted in a very open and casual way. We are given the opportunity to listen to the class perform what we've written, and have smaller and larger group discussions. The instructor also seems to be very cognizant and intentional about the way he has structured the class and asks for feedback often.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: Professor Bell facilitated an environment in which students felt comfortable to share their writing and unique ideas.  I enjoyed how each student got a chance to share their work and also comment on other students writing.  I also think working in groups and having to communicate frequently was beneficial.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: He would let us read our scripts aloud in class to get feedback from our peers and reflect on our writing

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: I enjoyed the selection of a tv show with only one season out and the task to write a second season with a group. I also enjoyed the group feedback aspect in each script we reviewed, learning what parts of our writing stood out to others and what parts could be improved. I would keep the group review of scripts in future years.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: The learning environment was extremely helpful and rewarding. It was nice being able to hear ideas and feedback from our classmates.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: I liked the open setting of the class. I felt comfortable to give peer reviews and enjoyed having peer reviews given to me.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: I loved every component of this course. I think the general idea of watching the first season of a TV show, and writing the second season, is fantastic. And learning to collaborate and team-write is an extremely helpful tool to learn.

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?
response_text: It was stimulating because I had never taken a class in this field and it was a great introduction to it.

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?
response_text: Less in-class reading. Instead, show examples of other TV shows that do a good job with a point.

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?
response_text: I liked working with my team to break down a script and their characters.

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?
response_text: -we learned through practice! Being pushed to write regularly and hear thoughts from classmates was very stimulating.

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?
response_text: Being challenged to have to write off of a tv show that we only watched one or two times was very stimulating since it made us have to remember small details that could be plot points.

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?
response_text: I like that we get to hear what our classmates are working on, and that we can get immediate, constructive feedback from the class and the instructor when we share our own writing.

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?
response_text: Each weekly assignment made the class stimulating, along with getting to work with other classmates to form one cohesive season of a TV show.

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?
response_text: It was really interesting to hear the different approaches that people took to writing their scripts. I think it helps a lot with idea generation being able to hear from your peers

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?
response_text: I enjoyed the group season 2 assignments as groups together had to come up with the storyline and ensure episodes tracked with individual episodes. I also enjoyed the zooms with the writers and actors on the show.

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?
response_text: This was my first opportunity to be in a creative writing styled course, and it was very rewarding. Learning to improve writing dialogue was very intellectually stimulating. Also, it was great hearing your classmates read out your script.

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?
response_text: It was about a topic that I had never explore before, which I thought was really cool

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?
response_text: Working with other people was one thing, and another thing is that these are some of my longest pieces of writing that I have ever written.

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?
response_text: You should absolutely take this course. I learned to write in a way I never thought I could.

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?
response_text: Be prepared to get creative! Ideating and executing scripts is a creatively encompassing process, so do not shy away from your artistic side.

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?
response_text: I would recommend someone to take this class, even if they don't have any experience with this.

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?
response_text: This is course is incredibly fun and is well suited for students with a variety of experience levels within the field. You will learn a lot about creating a story, both in a creative way in a logistical way, and you will get to explore your own ideas.

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?
response_text: High recommend it, the class was enjoyable and Professor Bell is invested in getting to know his students and helping them improve.

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?
response_text: If you love to write but haven't tried out script writing before like me, learning how to write scripts and constantly getting feedback from classmates were both extremely enjoyable and helped me improve my writing. It is a low stress class where you get to learn as you go.

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?
response_text: I would say that they should 100% take it! One of my favorite courses at Duke!

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?
response_text: This class is very fun, laidback, and interesting. Because of the independent nature of the course, it requires that you hold yourself accountable to all your deadlines, but it is not difficult to be successful in this class if you put that small amount of effort in.

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?
response_text: This course is incredibly informative if you plan on doing anything in entertainment or screenwriting in the future. In addition to learning formatting and the technical elements of writing a screenplay, you develop communication skills in working with groups.

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?
response_text: If you have any interest in TV, movies, or entertainment in general I would highly recommend trying this class

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?
response_text: Definitely take it - it was very cool to learn about the process of developing a TV show and what happens in writing rooms.

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?
response_text: Heavily recommend.

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?
response_text: If you're interested in screen writing, this is a good way to see if you actually enjoy it or not.

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?
response_text: I would 1000% percent recommend this class. Neal Bell is an excellent teacher and I would definitely recommend.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: I learned how to write compelling and interesting stories and give and receive feedback. The latter two skills are critical to any kind of future in writing or collaborative work.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: dramatic action, how to craft stories that are compelling, and how to take critique from my peers

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: I honed in on my screenwriting skills, learned how to write in play format, and learned how to be part of a constructive writer's room.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text:
Refining Screenplays and Plays
Doing character readings
writing plot

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: I completed a substantial draft of a play that I had been planning for months. I learned how to listen to and selectively incorporate constructive feedback. I learned to persevere even when my writing was cringy or bad, and to then improve it or improve the next project.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: One thing I learned from this class is how to approach critiques when editing my writing. Before, I'd have a tendency to either completely disregard a critique (if I disagreed), or apply it in the same exact way ti was presented to me (if I agreed). Through this class, and through seeing how my classmates made edits to their writing, I learned how to take critiques into consideration while still fully making my own decisions about my work.I think that reading everyone's work helped me learn a lot about personal style and form, as there were so many different ways that we approached the same prompt that was really interesting, especially during the discussions after a reading

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: I really liked the casting classmates in our pieces. I learned a lot from hearing my writing read aloud and the feedback I received.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: i liked the short weekly prompts in the beginning to get our creativity flowing, but then after that we were mostly left alone to work on our projects however we saw fit to develop them from week to week

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: Professor Bell is wonderful and facilitated a very safe and welcoming environment where everyone felt comfortable sharing personal stories and offering candid reactions and unfiltered feedback.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: I think the way we would do readings was very interactive, and it really helped the whole class learn and bond

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: The class was flexible enough to allow everyone to choose their own projects -- some started entirely new things, some kept working on existing projects. Students were encouraged to take the lead and ask the class for specific feedback if we wanted. The class was also structured enough to make sure everyone made progress and learned. There was a good balance.

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?
response_text: People are hilarious and the energy of the class and Neal was amazing. I always looked forward to class and spoke often of the material from the class outside of it. By far the best class I took this semester.

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?
response_text: reading writing aloud in class and not only telling our peers "I liked this", but explaining why we liked it or why it was good really helped me in crafting my own writing

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?
response_text: I never knew what we were going to read when I got to class and it was always a great time and interesting.

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?
response_text: The fact that everyone had things they were excited to present, and everyone was excited to see what everyone else had written, that made the class great

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?
response_text: We had to write new things every week and then critique each other's work. We had lively discussions and all became better writers and critics. Prof. Bell also gives helpful and detailed feedback if you email him and ask him to look at a specific script.

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?
response_text: Take it if you enjoy creative writing and you want to have a space to explore storytelling. Take it even if you have very little experience; you'll learn a lot by having a structured time to write and explore yourself.

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?
response_text: Prof. Bell is the absolute best. He provides really insightful critique of your writing and asks pointed questions to help you improve without it ever feeling like an attack or overwhelming. He also guides the class to explain why they liked a piece of writing (the characters felt 3D, the dramatic action was well-paced, etc) beyond just "I liked it" which is really helpful as a budding writer

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?
response_text: Definitely take this class if you're interested at getting better at screenwriting or playwriting! I loved every minute of being in this class.

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?
response_text: It's awesome, 100% recommend

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?
response_text: Take it! Prof. Bell is awesome, and the class size is such that we all developed a great rapport that made it fun to share our work.

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?
response_text: Being able to work towards one final project throughout the semester way incredibly rewarding, and it was definitely the highlight of my week this semester. Take this class if you can, you will not regret it!
